data.title: Fun menu!
data.text: We ate here on Saturday evening and enjoyed our experience at Aji10. Empanadas and arepas were tasty and well prepared. All of our entrees were also delicious. I had the meat platter and it was not only really delicious but plentiful.

data.title: Can't wait to go back
data.text: Every dish we had was spectacular.  The mussels had one of the best broths I've ever had.  The margaritas were perfect and tasted very fresh.

data.title: A restaurant worth exploring
data.text: AJI10 Latin Cuisine & Pisco Bar is hard to define. The restaurant describes its food as a multicultural spirt of Latin America and Nikkei Cuisine, a fusion of Japanese-Peruvian cultures. However, also offered are South, Central, North American and Caribbean Island dishes. As you would expect from the description, the menu is quite large and varied. I started out with Arepas, Venezuelan corn cakes with a choice of stuffing. I picked two types, Perni--- slow cooked pork which was juicy and tender, and Vegetarian---plantain, avocado and black beans, also delicious. For my entrée I selected the daily special, Grilled Seafood--clams, mussels, octopus, crabs, shrimps and lobster on a mixed salad. The portion was generous, and the seafood fresh, but the dish lacked flavor. The dessert, Churros, a donut type dough filled with dulce de leche and served with vanilla ice cream was too hard. The atmosphere is relaxed, the service friendly and helpful, and the prices very reasonable. Given the interesting menu, AIJ10 is certainly worth exploring.

data.title: Outstanding surprise
data.text: Casual, comfortable and generous--Caipirinha's like we haven't had since dining at the Brazilian Embassy. Macadamia encrusted spicy tuna sushi that melted in our mouths. A grilled seafood mix special was lovingly seasoned delicately with olive oil and herbs--perfect! A more than generous portion perfect to share. Along with the warm welcome and abundant service made the evening very special.  It's perfect for light meal of a selections of tapas and salad or substantial platter of steak-- ohh-- and those yucca fries!

data.title: Foodie destination in Norwalk
data.text:
The menu at Aji 10 is very interesting and different than any other restaurant in Norwalk.  More importantly, the food is also very well prepared.   I really like having the option to share tapas, choose from small plates, or even go for a typical size entree.  
We ate here again this week and were not disappointed.  My only negative was that the AC did not seem to do a great job where we were sitting.  I had asked to have the thermostat lowered twice, but it was still warmer than we were comfortable with.   After dinner, as we left, I realized that other areas of the restaurant were cooler.  I wish the waitress had suggested we move our table after we complained the second time.
This however will not prevent me from returning to Aji 10.

data.title: Unusually good kitchen, service
data.text: AJI 10 may have become our new favorite place for  relaxed and excellent meal in Norwalk.  We understand the chef is from Splash, the recently-closed restaurant at Longshore in Westport.  Four friends had dinner there recently and shared a large number of small plates, most with a Peruvian flare, walking away sated and satisfied.  The calamari salad, mixing lightly fried calamari with shredded lettuce, was so good we ordered another .  We ordered a narrow tuna pizza, a thin crust -- and narrow patty -- covered with sushi grade tuna.  A plate called Trio Causitas consisted of three different mouth-sized and mouth-watering fish concoctions.  A small plate of short ribs went quckly. A couple other dishes were equally good.  Only the churros were a little disappointing as they were reheated and not fresh.

data.title: Wonderful meal!
data.text: Amazing food, delicious flan, the arepas were outstanding. Also, recommended are the fried oysters and the macadamia encrusted sushi. Can't wait to go back!

data.title: Delightful extraordinary food
data.text: We both had the ensalada nueva andina - a perfectly crafted salad with greens, cucumber, quinoa, cheese, a seemingly endless array of chopped vegetables and nuts!  Never had cashews in a salad before and found them a delightful surprise.  Then we moved on to the soup of the day which turned out to be an amazing concoction of seafood.   Chicken with sour pineapple.  Caribe warm banana coconut roll.  All enjoyed thoroughly.  Only wished we had discovered this restaurant sooner!  Chef's wife runs the front of the house.  Chef comes with experience at a variety of well-regarded restaurants in the area as well as his own restaurant in Venezuela.  Everything was WOW.  Don't waste any more time....just go!  (Mojitos were excellent too!)

data.title: Excellent Food
data.text: We went here for the 1st time last Saturday with our 2 year old son...who by the way LOVES Latin food.  Everything we had as delicious!!  I ordered the Lomo Saltado which as amazing!!!  So tasty and great flavor!!!  We also had empanadas and anticuchos for appetizers...amaze balls!!  Drinks were fabulous too!!  It is on the pricier side but for good food I'd pay for it again!!

data.title: Memorable experience
data.text: Simply put, this was one of our best eating experiences in CT. and certainly as good a  'Latin' restaurant as any we've eaten in in CT. or NY, though there are several excellent alternatives here in New Haven. The veggies were fresh, the portions generous, the saucing distinctive, but light, and the fish and meats done to perfection. Starting with drinks: the Pisco sour was the best I've had outside of Peru, the traditional mohito was more elegant than dramatic and Alborino was excellent. For appetizers, we went with the special baked oysters instead of the online recommendation of fried, and the short-rib tacos, 3 medium spheres slathered with a delicate combo of meat, tomatoes and the like.  The parmesean laced dressing for the oysters was perfect as were the delicate gems of oysters. My mains were a wonderful quinoa, cranberrie and greens salad that was large enough for a meal (I'm having leftovers for lunch) and a wonderful complement to the fish soup, my other main. The soup looked gorgeous with the white fish, squid, shrimp, etc clustered around a large crab leg sticking out of the center and the pieces were all large enough to eat separately and the variety reminded me of Lisbon. But the best was the supporting broth which must have been cooked for hours and had a deep, butterlike richness (no butter) without interfering with the fresh fish.  The steak was devoured to quickly by our host to taste, but I did taste my wife's lambchops and they were generous and incredibly flavorful.  She loved the scallop potatoes and said she hadn't any like these since her mother's.  We were too full and weight conscious to do much with deserts, so we just shared a passion fruit flan which was huge and stunning.  Next time the chocolate crepes. The prices are modest. In all, a memorable evening and not just because our friends picked up the bill.  Evan Stark

data.title: Unexpectedly Delicious
data.text: I came here with three couples and had no idea the place had changed. Parking was very easy around the corner.  And the food was simply delicious! The appetizers were especially good. Don't miss the fried oysters or the mussels, which might have been the best I ever had. Seriously. Try the generous sushi rolls or the parillada choices for your main course. Not fancy so you don't expect food this good. Go there!

data.title: What an interesting mix!!
data.text: So, when was the last time you had a Peruvian - Vietnamese dish (outside of Manhattan or LA)?  The restaurant itself is nice, but ordinarily nice.  The food is the thing and at good prices.  Seafood, seafood, seafood.

data.title: Better than I expected
data.text: Beautiful location and the food was great. I love the ambiance with the saxophone player. Prices are reasonable and the service was great

data.title: Eclectic with Latin overtones
data.text:
The prices here are not too bad considering that this is Fairfield County.
The shellfish special at $38 was a bargain. The codfish menu item, served with the same sauce as the lobster, was equally superb. The short rib menu item won praise from the third member of our party. The empanada appetizer, in turn, had our party of three fighting for more than an equal share. The coconut martini also won praises from the table.
The crepe and cheesecake desserts, while tasty, were not quite up to the high standards set by the main courses and the appetizer. 
Value grade = A

data.title: An excellent new find
data.text: As we left the nearby movie theater we noticed that this restaurant had changed ownership and decided to try it.  The food and service were great!!  The menu is varied with mostly  Latin cuisine and some Latin-Japanese fusion dishes.  It works well.  I started with Arepas stuffed with churrasco. My wife had a really special ensalada nueva andina that she loved.  I also had the ceviche mixto which was outstanding.  We look forward to going back to try some of the fusion dishes like the tempura lobster mixed with Peruvian aioli.  Very enjoyable dinner

data.title: Overhyped
data.text:
Dont understand why the reviews are so great
Food meh
Small portions
A big dissapointment
Dont believe the hype

data.title: Great Flavors!
data.text: Service was great! The food was awesome!! The fried oysters appetizer is a must. I had the salmon and cream cheese sushi with sweet plantain on too. Hands down...one of the best sushi I've had. The plantain gave it a special twist. We will definitely go back!!!!!

data.title: Delicioso!
data.text: Great restaurant, amazing menu, fabulous food, attentive staff. Chicarrones, arepas, empanadas are so good. Asian chicken salad for lunch is crunchy and delicious. Owner came from a well known local restaurant a town over that recently closed, and Norwalk gets to benefit from it!

data.title: Outstanding, creative and unique dishes expertly prepared.  Congrats!
data.text: I have enjoyed Aji10 now for the past couple of months.  The menu is loaded with variety with an emphasis on fish dishes.  I would characterize the style as a peruvian/japanese fusion.  Every single dish that I have personally tried, has been incredible.  This is a must visit restaurant in Fairfield County.  I don't give many "Excellent" ratings but this gets one, hands down.   Highly Recommended.  Chaz

data.title: Something very special here
data.text: It all came together at a delicious meal for a large group of us - the food, the service, the atmosphere all wonderful.  I am always reluctant to book reservations for large groups (12) - as a waiter, I used to hate it - but the folks at Aji10 handled it perfectly.  We will be back!
